instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2915-B, sensor issue after GPU Replacement
threads.message:
i replaced the GPU, then i had a sensor problem 
TP0P and Tm0P
where is placed this sensor ?
does anyone have the sensor placement ?

threads.title: 820-2915-B, sensor issue after GPU Replacement
threads.message:
I found a broken pin in track pad connector on the board, I repaired it.
but the same problem, I replaced also the track pad and the flex. 
I will upload a picture for the sensor issue

threads.title: 820-2915-B, sensor issue after GPU Replacement
threads.message:
The first suspects there are trackpad and ALS.
I still suspect trackpad connection in your case.
But try disconnecting camera cable.

Just in case, post diode mode to ground and voltage for R5222/23.

threads.title: 820-2915-B, sensor issue after GPU Replacement
threads.message:
ok, I verified the ALS, Trackpad tested on another MacBook body, the fan spin fast and same problem

i replaced the smc, U5550, and verified i2c line all is good...

threads.title: 820-2915-B, sensor issue after GPU Replacement
threads.message: You've got PCH proximity error, which is U5570 related...
